edu.purdue.cc.jsysnet.util
Class Correlation

java.lang.Object
  edu.purdue.cc.jsysnet.util.Correlation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pair<Molecule>
public class Correlation
extends Object
implements Pair<Molecule>

A class for connecting two Molecules and determining their correlation coefficient.

Author:
Thomas McGrew

                   Molecule molecule2,

Parameters:
molecule1 - The first Molecule of this Correlation.
molecule2 - The second Molecule of this Correlation.
experiment - The experiment this Correlation is associated with.

Correlation

public Correlation(Molecule[] molecules,
                   Experiment experiment)
Constructor which accepts an array of 2 Molecules.

Parameters:
molecules - A Molecule array of length 2. Any extra values are ignored.
experiment - The experiment this Correlation is associated with.

getDefaultMethod

@Deprecated
public static int getDefaultMethod()
Deprecated. Having a default method presents problems with multiple experiment instances. This method will be removed in a future version.

Returns the current default method to be used in Correlation calculations.

Returns:
an int representing the current default method.

setDefaultMethod

@Deprecated
public static boolean setDefaultMethod(int method)
Deprecated. Having a default method presents problems with multiple experiment instances. This method will be removed in a future version.

Sets the default calculation method for all Correlations.

Parameters:
method - The method to be used.
Returns:
true on success, false on failure.

getMolecules

public Molecule[] getMolecules()
Gets the Molecules associated with this Correlation.

Returns:
A Molecule array of length 2, containing the 2 Molecules associated with this correlation.

getOpposite

public Molecule getOpposite(Molecule molecule)
Returns the other molecule in this Correlation

Specified by:
getOpposite in interface Pair<Molecule>
Parameters:
molecule - The Molecule you wish to get the opposite of.
Returns:
The opposite Molecule from the passed in Molecule which is assiciated with this correlation. Returns null if the passed in Molecule is not associated with this Correlation.

getValue

@Deprecated
public double getValue()
Deprecated. Having a default method presents problems with multiple experiment instances. This method will be removed in a future version.

Gets the correlation coefficient of this Correlation.

Returns:
A double containing the last calculated correlation coeficcient. Defaults to PEARSON.

Deprecated. Having a default method presents problems with multiple experiment instances. This method will be removed in a future version.

Gets the correlation coeffiecient of this Correlation

Parameters:
recalculate - Whether or not to recalculate this value if it has already been calculated.
Returns:
A double containing the last calculated correlation coeficcient.

getValue

public double getValue(int method)
Gets the correlation coeffiecient of this Correlation

Parameters:
method - The coefficient calculation method to use. Should be one of Correlation.PEARSON, Correlation.SPEARMAN, or Correlation.KENDALL.
Returns:
A double containing the requested correlation value.

getValue

public double getValue(int method,
                       boolean recalculate)
Gets the correlation coefficient of this Correlation.

Parameters:
method - The coefficient calculation method to use. Should be one of Correlation.PEARSON, Correlation.SPEARMAN, or Correlation.KENDALL.
recalculate - Whether or not to recalculate this value if it has already been calculated.
Returns:
A double containing the requested correlation value.

getPearsonCorrelation

public double getPearsonCorrelation()
Returns the Pearson correlation coefficient of the 2 molecueles.

Returns:
The Pearson correlation value.

getPearsonCorrelation

public double getPearsonCorrelation(boolean recalculate)
Returns the Pearson correlation coefficient of the 2 molecueles.

Parameters:
recalculate - True if you want the value recalculated, otherwise a cached value will be returned if present.
Returns:
The Pearson correlation value.

getSpearmanCorrelation

public double getSpearmanCorrelation()
Returns the Spearman rank correlation coefficient of the 2 molecules.

Returns:
The Spearman correlation value.

getSpearmanCorrelation

public double getSpearmanCorrelation(boolean recalculate)
Returns the Spearman rank correlation coefficient of the 2 molecules.

Parameters:
recalculate - True if you want the value recalculated, otherwise a cached value will be returned if present.
Returns:
The Spearman correlation value.

getKendallCorrelation

public double getKendallCorrelation()
Returns the Kendall tau-b rank correlation coefficient of the 2 molecules.

Returns:
The Kendall tau correlation value.

getKendallCorrelation

public double getKendallCorrelation(boolean recalculate)
Returns the Kendall tau-b rank correlation coefficient of the 2 molecules.

Parameters:
recalculate - Whether or not to recalculate this value if it has already been calculated.
Returns:
The Kendall tau correlation value.

filterZeros

public static void filterZeros(List<Number> list0,
                               List<Number> list1)
Removes an element from both lists when the element in either is equal to 0. Double.compare( ) is used to determine this. This operation is destructive and therefore you should pass a copy of the List if you do not want the original to be modified.

Parameters:
list0 - The first list to be filtered.
list1 - The second list to be filtered.

toString

public String toString()
Returns a string representation of this Correlation.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
a String representing this Correlation.

getCriticalValues

public static double[] getCriticalValues(int method,
                                         int sampleCount)
Returns the critical values for 0.1, 0.05, 0.02, and 0.01 for the given method and sample count. A value of -1 means that there is no critical value for this entry.

Parameters:
method - The method to get the critical values for. Should be one of Correlation.PEARSON, Correlation.SPEARMAN, or Correlation.KENDALL.
sampleCount - The number of samples for which to get the critical values for.
Returns:
The critical values for 0.1, 0.05, 0.02, and 0.01.
